TOKENS: x a -/d
NOTE: xad is the original form. The stop /d/ resurfaces before vowels, like in 11

TOKENS: ð a
NOTE: it is an open question if the two forms of the units should be derived from each other or treated as different morphemes. In my opinion, only the numbers 4 and eight are transparently derived from each other, while all the rest are different enough to mark them as separate morphemes
